answers.answer: One of my old friends , had her baby at 24weeks , and now he is a healthy lil 9 year old , abit 2 cheeky lol but he just fine , am sure your baby will fine so try not worry i know it hards , but just think the best , hope your health is ok to , keep us updated x
You'll be fine. As much reading I've done about early births at 34 weeks your baby should be fine... Trust in the doctor they have machines and things to help the baby...

Here's a little info I dug up for you. Good luck.. :)Image result for can a baby survive at 34 weeks if bornIf you've been nervous about going into premature labour, you'll be happy to know that 99 per cent of babies born at 34 weeks can survive outside the uterus (womb) – and most have no major problems. Although your baby's central nervous system is still maturing, her lungs are nearly fully developed by now.
Thanks so much ladies! I appreciate the input, all the positive feedback makes me feel so much better. All these words of encouragement are very appreciated,

question: Have any of you mommies had a baby at 34 weeks or earlier I am supposed to get a c section Friday due to having mild preeclampsia, I am so scared because I want me baby to be healthy, anybody have advice or an experience they can share? Thanks for reading!
